tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,
context: Pregnancy Check Up,Normal Vaginal Delivery (NVD),Pregnancy Exercise,PCOD/PCOS Treatment,Family Planning,
review:
Please visit Anjani without any second thought. 

I would definitely recommend Dr.Kalyani for planning and other gynac-issues. I met her about a year ago for conceiving problem. And, I am reviewing her hospital after a month of my Normal vaginal delivery, with my my bundle of joy right beside me!

My husband and I decided to meet a Gynac after trying to conceive for about 6 to 8 months in 2023, we fortunately met Dr.Kalyani. I was comfortable meeting her for the first time and decided to continue visiting her. She is an amiable person. Initially she went through my history-details thoroughly and asked me to do few preliminary checks.

Dr. Kalyani attends all her patients with due care, empathy and individual attention. Please feel free to meet her and discuss all your concerns with no hesitation. I'm sure the best possible resolution would be given to you. She tracked me well through my pregnancy when my family was away and my husband stood should to shoulder. This indeed helped me take great care of myself & my baby while I was carrying.

Dr.Kalyani's approach is always quite pragmatic. My BMI was already in required range. Thereby, 'weight' was never my concern. She noted that I was slightly anemic though my cycles were regular. She suspected ovarian cyst formation as I experienced signs of bloated stomach, though my cycles were monthly/ timed. My only signs of disorder were pimples and slightly bloated tummy. Also, my sleep patterns varied too, due to IT work/ shifts. She double checked for "PCOD or cyst formation" and if it is in the preliminary stage. She checked if I am ovulating properly (if Anovulatory), which was luckily not my case. Later, she confirmed that my major concern was Cyst-formation and prescribed medical-aid accordingly. Mild medication was suggested to me. She told that I would see the results in few months.

Of course, she made me incorporate certain changes in my diet and lifestyle. I followed them all with due diligence. Yet I used to express my anxiety during visits. She told us to be cool, carefree and enjoy the life before carrying, which is very true. In the next 3 months, it happened as she promised. I was tested positive during the beginning of my 2nd month of pregnancy. What more could I have asked for!

She always insists NVD or normal vaginal delivery. Hence, one must be mindful about the daily intake. It should be both balanced and fibrous in nature. (Please note, BMI ratio plays a crucial part here. It could become the cause of your health concern, if neglected). "You are what you eat" - as the saying goes.

Her clinic is well equipped, well maintained and modular. Both scanning facility and labor facility are available here. The protocols followed here are in favor of NVD. My scans were done quite efficiently though there were errors while printing one of my scan reports. Please cross-check before breaking down like me, thinking that all the effort went in vain. There is a Physiotherapy section too. Physiotherapist Gayathri taught me useful exercises, breathing techniques and birthing ball exercises from 36th week. The pelvic floor exercises really helped me reduce the pelvic muscle catch. The clinic is crowded by aspiring parents, but the labor unit is kept separate (yet interconnected) and conducive for delivery. This helped me walk around and exercise peacefully during my labor. I was able to firmly decide the next steps of my delivery when there was some risk posed at me.

I was very anxious about the pregnancy journey, I experienced heavy cramping in my 2nd month. In the initial 3 months I confined myself to a single room, due to extreme nausea. I was losing hope while dizziness and mood swings took over. I was unable to eat my meal (except 2-3 fruits) or enjoy a cup of warm milk, which I used to. I was unsure about reaching next trimester, if things would remain the same in future, etc. Dr. Kalyani pushed me and told that things shall pass. Yes, it did get better as she said.

The next 3 months were pleasant. I was bubbling with energy. Whenever I asked what is happening inside me, she would answer all my why's very elaborately and convincingly. I was told to maintain BMI, put on some weight (weight loss due to vomiting), take supplements regularly, focus on nutrition and eat healthy, which is always important. There were some false pains, etc, but my doctor was always available. All through my pregnancy, she has responded to my requests very quickly. She responds to both chat/ WhatsApp messages and urgent calls. She has attended my calls always, even during late night.

And the last trimester was a bit horrid due to my delivery-related concerns. "It's all in your head" - as the saying goes. I informed Dr.Kalyani that my family is away and could not get much help from them. I felt restless and used to lose sleep thinking of the labor day, stay awake to think about the how's. Problems were merely pondered, be it about bearing the birthing-pain, handling myself carefully until baby becomes full-term, taking care of my new born post delivery, adequately nurturing my child, etc. During one of my visits I enlisted my concerns, she gave solutions to each and every problem and instilled confidence in me to handle everything by myself. In fact, she told that it would be better to do things by self and remain active (Self-Help) than to rely on other family members. Also, when I reached the last leg of my pregnancy, she told my husband to not pamper me much. Her intent was good, so as to make me feel more responsible, deliver quickly and normally. Later, I had the same kind of delivery. My delivery pain subsided in few hours, though I slept on the birthing pain issue for months.  

At the mid of my labor, she gave me the liberty to choose NVG (normal vaginal delivery over C-section) though there was some undetected risk involved. Had I visited any other renowned hospital for my delivery, this wouldn't have been the case, I believe. We really admire the expertise with which she delivered our cord-around-the-neck baby normally.

We are thankful to the labor team for safe birthing experience. I cannot forget mentioning miss Revathi for her constant backing, great patience and assistance during labor. Post delivery, the day shift staff took much care of my new born and helped me feed in a right posture. All in all, it's been a pleasant journey with 'Anjani'. The very name is indeed powerful (she who ferverently prayed for a strong child, to beget Lord Hanuman as her son). Please visit Anjani and pass the toughest exam of womanhood with flying colors, just like Maa Anjani.

We wish you the best, team Anjani. Wish you the best, Dr.Kalyani, can't thank you enough ma'am. Wish the expecting mothers to have an easy delivery and healthy baby at Anjani :)

** ******* ***** ** *** ** *** **** ************ ** ********* 
Would highly recommend the doctor for pregnancy Care and Childbirth 

She treated me right from conceiving till childbirth and we had a good experience getting treated here in both of my pregnancy

for providing us wonderful experience through this Journey

review: We were consulting kalyani Reddy madam from first month of pregnancy, madam is very cool and calm in nature . We were in confusion whether to choose corporate hospitals like cloudnine or manipal which is near to our home or anjani hospital which is about 30 mins far for us .. my wife is very comfortable with kalyani madam and so we have decided to go with anjani hospital, which turned out to be best decision which  we have taken . She is a pro in handling complex pregnancies , we took the in house physiotherapist help and have done the necessary exercises and at the time of labour it has helped a lot .. during labour it took almost a day and half  for my wife to dilate completely , I am 100 percent sure that the corporate hospitals would have never waited this long for normal delivery to happen .. at night 12 clock also madam stayed and helped my wife to deliver my cute little angel vaginally (normal delivery) even though there has been an umbilical cord around baby's neck and has created some panic situation  . review:
We are extremely grateful to Dr. Kalyani Reddy at Anjani Hospital for the exceptional care and support during the delivery of our baby girl. During labor, our baby passed motion inside the womb. Despite this critical situation, Kalyani doctor handled it with utmost professionalism. but thanks to physical exercise and the doctor's guidance, I was able to have a normal delivery.

For those consulting on normal delivery, I highly recommend following the physical exercise suggestions provided by the physiotherapist at Anjani Hospital. These include duck walks, squats, ball exercises, and walking at least 8000 steps daily. Additionally, maintaining a healthy diet during the 9th month is crucial. Focus on balanced nutrition to avoid excessive weight gain for both the mother and the baby.

We appreciate the doctor's expertise and compassionate approach during this critical time. Highly recommend Dr kalyani Reddy and the entire team at Anjani Hospital

review:
I am writing to extend my heartfelt thanks for the outstanding post-delivery care you provided. Your attentive and compassionate approach made a significant difference during my recovery period. 

One piece of advice my doctor consistently gave to me and others was to be cautious with our diets during the last trimester of pregnancy. Failing to do so could result in the baby growing too large, leading to severe complications during delivery and recovery. I strongly recommend that every expectant mother strictly follow their doctor's advice. 

During the last two months of pregnancy, it's essential to prioritize both the mother's and baby's health. Here are some precautions to consider: 

1. Regular prenatal check-ups: Keep up with scheduled appointments with your healthcare provider to monitor both the mother's and baby's health. 

2. Monitor baby's movements: Pay attention to the baby's movements and report any significant changes to your healthcare provider. 

3. Stay hydrated: Drink plenty of water to stay hydrated, which is crucial for both mother and baby. 

4. Get enough rest: Ensure adequate rest and sleep to support your body as it prepares for childbirth. 

5. Eat a balanced diet: Maintain a nutritious diet with a variety of fruits, vegetables, whole grains, lean proteins, and healthy fats. 

6. Avoid risky activities: Refrain from activities that could pose a risk to you or the baby, such as heavy lifting or strenuous exercise without clearance from your healthcare provider. 

7. Pelvic floor exercises: Practice pelvic floor exercises to prepare for labor and childbirth. 

8. Attend childbirth classes: Consider attending childbirth classes to learn about the labor process, relaxation techniques, and pain management strategies. 

9. Prepare for childbirth: Pack your hospital bag, make arrangements for transportation to the hospital, and discuss your birth plan with your healthcare provider. 

10. Stay informed: Keep yourself informed about signs of preterm labor or complications, such as preeclampsia, and seek medical attention if you experience any concerning symptoms. 

Remember to consult with your healthcare provider for personalized advice based on your individual pregnancy and medical history.
reply_text: Thank you for your wonderful feedback üôèüèª

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,Wait time,
context: High-Risk Pregnancy Care,Pregnancy care and management,
review:
Hi Everyone, I want to share about my high-risk pregnancy experience. Because I had diabetes and was 35 years old when I gave birth, I was classified as having a high-risk pregnancy. My Hba1c was 8.4 at the time of conception, and I was rather worried about the fetal development. We went to the Anjani Hospital and had a consultation with Dr. Kalyani Reddy, madam. 

Dr. Kalyani inspired and counselled us and medications were provided. She also sent us to the dietician, Bindhu, who provided several recommendations for a diabetic diet, and to Dr. Prasanna Kumar, the diabetologist for diabetes control. Dr. Kalyani ensured that we are aware of potential difficulties, every screening step was completed at the appropriate time, and the risk was frequently discussed.

The scanning capability of Anjani Hospital is well built-in. Dr. Raja Munireddy performed all of my scans and the reports were shared on time. Dr. Kalyani madam, diabetologist Dr. Prasanna Kumar and Dr. Raja sir, collaborated and coordinated well. I took insulin the entire time I was pregnant. Because of high-risk pregnancy entails problems, I was worried about an early birth. However, with the support and guidance of Doctors a health baby was finally born at the 38th week. 

My child was delivered via caesarean section. We express our gratitude to Dr. Kalyani and Dr. Ravi, as well as the rest of the medical staff that assisted with my pregnancy care, delivery and post delivery care. I want to express my gratitude to everyone of the personnel, medical and non-medical, for the excellent care they gave us from the Day 1 we visited the hospital. This was my incredible pregnancy adventure, and I'm sharing it to support future moms who may come across similar experience.
reply_text: Thank you for your wonderful feedback üôèüèª

Now for our second child birth again we had come to her, like last time we have had our complete trust in Dr Kalyani. 
She is very cool minded, confident, listens to her patients and her treatment has always worked never have ever gone back to her with same problem. 
We wish all the best and may god‚Äôs grace always be on her‚Ä¶!

tags: Explanation of the health issue,Doctor friendliness,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,
review:
I highly recommend Dr. Kalyani Reddy mam. She is a very patient, caring and practical person and tells you exactly what we need to do if we are looking forward for a normal delivery and welcome a healthy baby. She pushes us so much for a normal delivery which we don‚Äôt see much nowadays. I believe she is great doctor who really wants the best for us so just trust her and follow her advice. I have followed all her advices from the beginning! Mentioning a few of them if it helps any one of you:
1.Please give your body the rest if she tells that you need to rest especially in the first trimester.
2. We should be very mindful of what we eat! She clearly explains why it is so important to eat a balanced diet rich in fibre. So, please avoid a lot of carbs throughout your pregnancy and also avoid a lot of protein in the 8th and 9th month.You can ask her advice on the same. This mainly helps in maintaining baby‚Äôs weight. Of course we all need a healthy baby but we have to understand that even if the baby is not 3.5 kg we can still have a healthy baby. So, if we can maintain our diet in such a way that by our due date the weight is max around 3.2 kg there are high chances for you to have a normal delivery. I know there are other factors that should be considered but I am only talking about things that we can control.
3. Thirdly, keeping yourself hydrated and exercises. Walking does help but what helped me more were the pelvic exercises. You can take a session from the physiotherapist and continue to do it daily without stressing your body. It helps!
4. Please don‚Äôt panic during the delivery! I think remaining calm if possible, breathing normally and not holding your pelvic area tight is so important! Else all your efforts will go into vain because we couldn‚Äôt manage the stress in those last few hours. I did lose my calm for a few seconds may be a minute but had to pull myself back. I don‚Äôt know if this will help anyone as this was my personal hack that I saw in one of the videos. It is to use a comb to distract myself from the contraction pain during that last hour of delivery and it surely helped me! You never know it can help you too! 

Finally, I am very glad that I chose Anjani hospital and Kalyani reddy mam. A shout out Raja A Munireddy sir as well for his patience and how well he explains things during scans! And also the entire staff who were really supportive. Both my baby and I are doing goodüòä
reply_text: Thank you Yashaswini for such wonderful feedback.It has been a good journey with you. Certainly your valuable feedback will be a guidance for many people.üôè

context: Pregnancy Check Up,Pre and Post Delivery Care,
review:
I began consulting Dr Kalyani in late 2016 just prior to and during my first pregnancy, which for unfortunate reasons ended in a silent miscarriage during the 7th week. Dr Kalyani was very supportive during this period and advised trying again in 3 months. 

Thankfully, we conceived again without problems earlier in 2017; Dr Kalyani was very pro-active in her attention towards ensuring all corners were covered this time: including regular tests and follow-ups. She was warm to talk to: professional at all times (reassuring not in a hazy/hand-wavy manner, but candid with facts, data & risks), as was Dr Ravi during our clinic visits. Dr Raja (radiologist/sonologist) was equally wonderful and made all our scans memorable. Highly recommend his calm demeanor, attention to detail and warmth during each one of these sessions.

For various reasons (and somewhat against Dr Kalyani's advise) - I decided to go back to my hometown for delivery during the 7th month. Although it wasn't intended this way, I stopped consulting Dr Kalyani after this under the assumption that I'll deliver in my home town.

Twist in the tale here: Due to rampant Dengue in my hometown (and very close to my due date) - my husband and I decided to go back to Bangalore since we found it too risky to continue to stay and expose myself to a potential infection. It was a pretty stressful day, culminating with my husband calling Dr Kalyani late night at 10PM explaining the situation to her. Honestly - we were extremely skeptical whether she would agree to see us given the unceremonious disappearance (against her advise) and the fact that I was so close to my due date: Instead, Dr Kalyani advised us calmly to return and prescribed emergency medication to keep during the travel should I go into labour during the journey back to Bangalore.

Upon return, we felt the calmest we had through the entire pregnancy. 10 days later, I delivered a healthy baby boy via normal labour that lasted all of 4 hours. 

In conclusion: I'm very happy & fortunate I consulted Dr Kalyani and followed her advise throughout. We hear about C-sections being de-facto these days: If you're pregnant / trying to conceive, my advise is that you consult Dr Kalyani - and you can be rest assured she will ensure the best possible outcomes for you and your baby (and normal delivery if it is possible at all);

Post-delivery, Dr Kalyani asked me to mention what I did right (which made labour so easy) - Just to answer that: in general, I stayed active throughout, avoided outside/junk food, overeating and did labour-friendly posture exercises  to some extent, daily 1 hour walk. Over and beyond that, it was just divine oversight over destiny. Stayed calm and positive - that's always advisable.

Many thanks to Dr Kalyani once again.

tags: Explanation of the health issue,Doctor friendliness,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,
review:
My Write up may look longer but after reading this you will know why Dr. Kalyani is most adored *** **** ***** ****** ** ***** ****** ***** **** ** ** ******* **** **** ** *** ***** I would now tell you my experience and hardships in delivering a baby boy of 3.6kgs with 50 cms height. By the way am only 5.2ft !
     Me and my hubby are married since Nov 2013 yrs and we have been trying for a child since Jan 2016. We have tried for 8 months (visited couple of gynecologists but was not satisfactory) and then consulted Dr. Kalyani.  
      Our First appointment with Dr. Kalyani :  We told our purpose of visit. She was so patient in listening to us. Then she asked about our family history, maternal history and health issues and did a few tests & checks where she found that I have PCOD (previous gynecs dint tell me about this). She has prescribed some tabs for 15 days and asked me to visit after my next month period but to our surprise.. Hurrayyyy..My Pregnancy Indicator Shows Positive!!! My mind said..Whats the magic she did to me?. So our new journey with Dr. Kalyani for my pregnancy started from Oct 2016. She has good team of Doctors .Dr. Ravi, Anesthician (Kalyani Mam husband), scan specialists who investigate on the baby development based on our feedback and suspicions about our family medical background which I felt very satisfactory. Why am stressing this is because of my father who is a Cancer patient and is bedridden for past one year. After lot of discussions I convinced my mom and Dad to come to Bangalore to support me as I dint want to change the Doctor (as it was a tough task for his health condition). Now my Due date was given as Jun 16th.   During my last visit Doctor has observed and told that she shall perform delivery on Wednesday (Jun 14th) as waiting till due date may sometimes have a threat of low fluid levels. Dont know whether my baby has listened to Doctor or Dr.Kalyani was so perfect in prediction, I started getting contractions on Tuesday (Jun 13th) evening. As per Doctors advice I got admitted to Ovum Hospital.
       This is another great phase in my delivery. I was shifted to Labor ward at 5 a.m on Wednesday . By 10.a.m, pains were so severe that I could not bear and requested for Epidural Injection. There comes Dr. Ravi @ 11 a.m. to give Injection. It requires lot of expertise and he made me feel so comfortable and relaxed with his friendly talks even in that painful stage. Its an art isnt it?! Dr.Kalyani came for the final war phase at 1.30. p.m. I was trying so hard but there is no progress in the baby position and twice the baby head came and went back!!! Due to this strain, baby's heart rate dropped to 90 bpm. Then Doc gave Oxygen mask which helped in picking up the heart beat again.(In similar situation in friends case, her Doctor made C section when Baby's heart beat dropped to 100 bpm). Then sister Mamta sat on my bed next to me pushing my belly and pressuring Baby to move, Dr. Kalyani instigating me to push. That moment, labor room was like a war room with everyone trying hard to bring the baby out . Around 2.45 p.m. I gave up and asked doctor to go for cesarean. Doctor got so furious and told- Keerthy..Think about your father and family situation,Who came all the way only for you..dont give up ! That shows her concern for her patients. That words really boosted me and I gave one hard try with all my energy and its done .Great Success..Welcome to our Little cutie Boy (weighing 3.64kgs) @3.03 pm. Its normal delivery for me only because of Doctor's STRONG DETERMINATION! 
   Based on my experience and observation, few words to tell about her is - She is very cool and patient in hearing our problems and analyses every point. Based on that, she starts medication but before that she tells her views and background for doing so. She is strongly determined for Patient,s Normal delivery. 
    Today am so happy for my decision and thankful to Dr. Kalyani and am sure that anyone will have the same experience with her.\n

tags: None
review:
I first consulted Dr. Kalyani for assisting me in conceiving. The very first consultation with the doctor convinced me to get my delivery done by Dr. Kalyani.  The doctor was very friendly, kind, positive, listened patiently to all the queries and explained the treatment. With her advice I was able to conceive within 2 months.
The regular follow-ups during the pregnancy duration were very pleasant and the doctor always motivated me to go for normal delivery. She advised to maintain proper weight, and during the third trimester asked me to do squats , yoga, walking and household works, as being active helps in normal delivery.
During my third trimester scan, it was found that the chord was around baby's neck.  The doctor asked us not to worry and said she would try to do a normal delivery.
During my last checkup, Dr. Ravi who is Dr. Kalyani's husband and anaesthetist recommended epidural which reduces labour pain significantly and aids in fast dilation. During our visits to Dr. Kalyani, we developed a great confidence on the doctor. So we readily agreed for it. 
On the start of 40th week, I got labour pains. It was a Sunday and I got admitted at 8pm.  Doctor checked me at 9pm and said that dilation was happening good and I might not even require epidural as there was possibility of baby to be born in 2 or 3 hours. At 11 pm again she checked and this time though there was some more dilation, it did not progress as fast as it was thought. By this time, I started getting intense pains and wanted epidural badly. But since chord was around baby's neck, the baby's heart rate at 2 contractions dipped to 90.  After that, heart rate again improved. Dr. Ravi suggested wait for some more time to make sure baby's heartbeat was steady above 120 before giving epidural. (He said if the heart rate dips alarmingly low, we have to do c section. Having both epidural and c section is not good).
Luckily the baby's heartbeat‚Äã became steady and after half an hour observation I was given epidural by Dr. Ravi. The pain reduced a lot and I even slept for 15 mins. It was past midnight by then. At around 1.50AM the dilation reached 10cm and I was all set to deliver.
Dr. Kalyani was monitoring the baby's heartbeat and motivating me to bear the final pain. Doctor, nurses and I were trying hard for 45 minutes. The baby almost came out but the chord was pulling him back a number of times.  At 2.45AM, the doctor suggested to use vacuum as a last try for normal delivery.  Finally with all strength I and nurses pushed and doctor used vacuum to pull the baby at the same time.  Baby's head had come out and chord was around the neck.  Doctor cut the chord and pulled the baby out. Finally at ,3AM my baby was born.
The doctor took calculated risk and it paid off well.  She is always available in case of emergency. I advise the patients to close their eyes and believe in Dr. Kalyani. She will take care of her patients with her experience and sincerity.
Anjani women's hospital is well maintained and clean. It has in-house scan, blood test facility and pharmacy. Support staffs are very helpful.
Thank you so much doctor Kalyani and Dr. Ravi for all the positive experience. I salute your service.

I hope this message finds you well. My name is Rakshitha Shivu, and I wanted to express my heartfelt appreciation for the outstanding care I received under Kalyani mam guidance during my pregnancy journey.

It has been more than a year since I began consulting with kalyani mam, and I must say that recommending Dr.kalyani services is a decision I make without any hesitation. Her calm demeanor, attentive listening, and clear explanations to all our concerns have made this experience truly comforting.

Her friendly and gentle approach, coupled with immense patience in addressing our queries, provided us with the assurance we needed. Following her guidance has undoubtedly played a crucial role in ensuring a smooth pregnancy and eventually a normal delivery.

I would like to highlight the exceptional care provided during the labor. her constant availability, preference for normal delivery, and the support of your dedicated staff made a significant impact. Despite the complications with the cord around the baby's neck, her expertise and the assistance of the vacuum led to a successful normal delivery. I am immensely grateful for Dr.kalyani dedication and the supportive nature of your staff, who were friendly and polite throughout.

The hospital environment, with spacious and well-maintained rooms, felt like a home away from home. Your team's encouragement and assistance during those challenging times helped me navigate through the experience and welcome my little bundle of joy.

Once again, thank you, Dr. Kalyani Mam, and the entire crew, for your unwavering support and exceptional care.

Warm regards,

Rakshitha Shivu

context: Labor and Delivery,Pre and Post Delivery Care,
review:
I delivered a baby girl on 29th of August and I am really thankful to Dr Kalyani C Reddy for the way she managed my pregnancy days with utmost care. When we came to know about pregnancy being first time mother I was worried about which Doctor to consult but one of my colleague who is local to Bangalore referred Dr Kalyani *** **** *** ** *** ** *** **** ************ *** *** *** ** **********

The first time we met her we were very much satisfied with the consultation. The best thing about her is she is very calm, poised, vibrant, and vivacious with her unique personality of caring, supportive nature.The moment you start interacting with her, you will feel the positivity around you.

It was not an easy pregnancy for me as I was having severe gastritis from childhood and on the 2nd month I developed gestational diabetes. I could not able to take regular medication of Iron or calcium. She used to keep on changing doses and medicines to suite my health and each time¬† I visit her she used to do extensive counselling as I was not able to cope up with all the changes happening around me because of Pregnancy.

The real shocker came when I was in my 7th month and the baby was already in head down position. She insisted there might be possibility of early delivery and gave steroid and advised bed rest as precaution. At this point of time I was very apprehensive about my delivery but she gave me confidence that not to worry and there are still high chances of normal delivery if the sugar levels are under control.

On 34 week itself she found cervix is dilated to 3 cm but she insisted me that as long as I can keep the baby inside I should keep it and should come to hospital once I get labor pain on regular interval. As first time mother I was anxious and used to call her each time I get even little bit of pain and even went once to her clinic asking her to admit me as I was not sure how is the pain but she was very clear that even if the baby can stay in womb for 1 extra day we should keep it.

Finally on date of delivery when I got admitted to hospital my pulse rate was very high as I could not able to sleep last night because of high tension. She came to me and asked to calm down and explained that there is every possibility of Normal delivery but just because of anxiety I should not get into C-section. After talking to her the pulse rate came down  üòÑ and ask my husband to present in labor room to make me feel comfortable. She also clarified that looking at the family history the labor will be very short and said no need of epidural. After 2 hours of labor I delivered a baby girl.

Anyone who listens that it was normal delivery they are not able to believe looking at my health condition and the general concept that in Bangalore normal delivery is a distant dream. But I can proudly say to them that "YES!!! I delivered normally‚Äù

Thank you soooo much Ma'm for whatever you have done... it's a unique and memorable experience for both of us.

I would highly recommend Dr Kalyani to all the expecting mothers especially to go and experience her care and realize it by themselves.

tags: None
review:
I am Bhargavi, Gave birth to beautiful boy with weight 3.72 kg through normal delivery on 14th October 2016. 
I want to summarize my awesome experience with Dr Kalyani madam and Dr Ravi Sir.
I started visiting Anjani women's day clinic from the first month of my pregnancy. Dr kalyani madam was so patient to listen all of our queries and she was taking at least 20 mins to explain us each time we visit. She never got irritated even once during our 9 months journey. 
She could have had so many sleepless nights in the hospital with labour patients but she never showed her tiredness or laziness when we went for consultation. 
She will be calm, open minded, gentle and smiley always. 
She will create a kind of bond in patients so that you will never think of other doctor in your entire pregnancy even though if you would have visited other doctors before coming to her. Best example is one of my colleague who changed her doctor in the 5th month and she suppose to go to her native in the 7th month but she cancelled that because she want to be with Dr Kalyani till she get delivered. Even I had a lot of pressure from my parents in the 7th month but I too cancelled going native. 
*** ** **** **** *********** *** ******** *** *** ******* **** ************ ******** She will put 100% commitment in her work and expects 100% results.
As per my personal experience she hold a medical rank of 80.This is a major achievement and shows us her talent and commitment towards work.

Finally I want to share my delivery experience.

I admitted hospital on 13 the October 6 pm since my due date was 14th october. Doctor came at 8 pm and induced the pains to me because I had not developed natural pains. Doctor finished her consultations and came back at 11pm. Full night doctor was in hospital watching my progress of delivery. Around 3 am i developed mild pains and by 5am I got full pains and I couldn't bare my pains after 5.30 am. I started forcing the doctor to go for section. She convinced a lot to bare pains but I forced her to go for section. Finally by 6 am doctor arranged for section by seeing my condition. There comes one more experience doctor Dr Ravi sir, experienced anastasian and who is also Kalyani madam's husband, both convinced me to bare pains for 30 mins more to develop strong contractions. They told me that I am in a favourable condition for normal delivery where many other patients will not have and they also said that its not their profession to push normal delivery patient for section. They could have done the section and its 15 mins job for them but their commitment to the work is entirely different when compare to other doctors. Wellbeing of the patient is very important to the both the doctors. 
At 7 am Dr Ravi sir induced some painless  called epidural which reduced my pains by 60-70%. This will be given only when you have strong contractions. Those who are planing for normal delivery, please don't think about pains.Doctors will control your pains if your baby condition is good for a normal delivery.

 Again 2-3 times I pushed the doctors for section but they convinced me very well to bare pains. Finally by 11 am they stopped giving painless and I couldn't control my pains. Everyone must have to bare this pain for 1-2 hours if you want normal delivery. By 12 pm I was in a better condition for normal delivery. Dr Ravi sir, Kalyani madam and sister's provided lot of support to push my baby. By 12.35 pm I gave a birth to baby boy whose weight was 3.72 kg.
Both the doctors cancelled their consultations and they were with me till I get delivered. I don't have words to describe the doctors and I can only suggest that believe in Dr Kalyani madam and Dr Ravi sir and stick to their decision's. If your baby is in a good condition for normal delivery then doctors will put their 100% effort for normal delivery.
I am a soft female and my height is 5.3 and many of my relatives told that you will never get a normal delivery and now they still can't believe that I have delivered normally with a baby weight of 3.72 kg. Even I couldn't believe this

review: I had a very smooth experience with Dr. Kalyani. I cannot express gratitude in words though i would like to encourage every other pregnant girl to heed to what your Doctor has to say! Dr. Kalyani helped me overcome my fears when i was in my lowest . I had a missed abortion in late 2021 and after that i met Dr Kalyani in March 2022 just for a regular checkup , to know when can i plan for pregnancy further etc! I was so much in self doubt but i think with her counselling it was pretty easy to believe in myself and we naturally conceived in June 2022! My pregnancy journey has also been very smooth with all the medicines provided by Doc, i even had hypertension which i think never posed a problem for development of my baby throughout. In my last month after growth scans , we found out our baby‚Äôs weight was increasing, doc suggested if i want a normal delivery i have to make few changes to my diet and stick to exercise/walking without any fail! I stopped eating rice and wheat completely and switched to Ragi/Jowar/Millets! I used to do 5k-7k steps daily as suggested by Doc! I think this all honest guidance helped me deliver a healthy baby weighing 3.1kgs normally. Also i would like to mention that the delivery process was also so encouraging and seamless! Doc and sisters waited for everything to happen naturally! No pain induction or any such thing was even mentioned or done with me! I was admitted at 1 pm afternoon where all i was asked to do was being active and do exercises and I delivered at night 1:30 am. So i think the greatest attribute of Dr Kalyani is being patient with her every patient and being honest in everything she does! Kudos to everyone at Anjani Hospital!

review: We are extremely happy and satisfied with Anjani hospital and Dr.Kalyani C Reddy, very calm, polite and ever pleasant personal, she is highly experienced professional, Hospital has all the facilities one needs with high standards, very clean and neat facility for OP consultation and big luxury rooms for overnight stay, the care you get from Anjani hospital is incomparable, and most importantly all these luxury comes with a very affordable price range( from my experience 25-30k less compared to other hospitals with same facility), Staffs are very friendly and experienced, they made sure we have had pleasant days with them, and you get utmost care by these people, I visited Anjani hospital when my wife conceived second time, prior to meeting Dr.Kalyani, I had visited three famous hospitals near kammanahalli, and we were not satisfied with them, we have had history of some complications during the pregnancy, so we were in search of a good gynecologist near kammanahalli, that's when we happened to talk to one of our family friend Mrs. Revathi, fortunately she was working at the same hospital as a senior staff, she referred us to Anjani clinic, She assured would get the best care and high quality treatment throughout, they have kept their promises all the way through, we felt like a family, they also have pediatrics doctor facility over the hospital. Thank you, Dr.Kalyani, Revathi, Sheena, and the entire Anjani Family, for giving us a stress-free, joyful 10 months. I will recommend Anjani Hospital for everyone.

review:
I am writing this review to express my deepest gratitude for the excellent treatment Dr Kalyani provided to my wife during her labour. Your expertise, patience, and support were instrumental in ensuring a safe and successful delivery. Your encouragement and motivation were particularly remarkable as my wife was attempting a normal delivery. You were always there to guide her through every step of the process, and your reassuring words kept her spirits high even during the most challenging moments. Your focus on making the experience as comfortable as possible for my wife was truly appreciated.
Moreover, your patience during the long labour process was exceptional. You took the time to explain everything to us and listened attentively to our concerns, even though you must have been exhausted after such a long procedure.
I am writing this review to express my deepest gratitude for the exceptional care that my wife received during her labour. The midwife and nursing staff, particularly Nurse Revathi,Vasanthi, Supriya, and Tamil, were phenomenal in their support and care for my wife throughout the entire process.
Their dedication and expertise were remarkable, especially when it came to motivating and encouraging my wife to opt for a normal delivery. They were always there to guide her through every step of the way, ensuring that she was as comfortable and relaxed as possible.
The staff's patience and support during the long labour process were particularly exceptional. They listened attentively to our concerns and worked tirelessly to ensure that my wife and our baby were safe and healthy throughout.
Nurse Revathi deserves a special mention for her outstanding support and care. She was always available, attentive, and empathetic, ensuring that we understood the process and the risks involved. She truly went above and beyond in her duties, and we are incredibly grateful for all that she has done for us.
Overall, we are very pleased with the level of care that my wife received at the hospital, and we would like to extend our sincere thanks to the midwife and nursing staff. They were instrumental in ensuring that my wife had a safe and successful delivery, and we cannot thank them enough.
Writing this review after 10 days of delivery just wanted to give honest review.

review: ******* *** ** *** ** *** **** ************** She always carries a smile on her face and is very patient in answering all our queries. She is very friendly and you feel really relaxed talking to her. I have never seen her being stressed. I have had a wonderful journey with her. the staff and all sisters are also very supportive.. Dr Raja scan doctor is also very good and explains everything very clearly in a nice way. My first delivery was done by kalyani mam, everything went very smooth and with her help I had a normal delivery and was blessed with a baby boy. now for my second pregnancy though I was settled in mangalore and I was not very satisfied with the doctor there. I came here to Bangalore after my 3rd month just to get treated from Kalyani mam. After the growth scan she advised me to eat low carbohydrate diet so that the baby‚Äôs weight won‚Äôt increase much and the delivery would be easy for me. when I got the labour pains she even picked my call at 4AM in the morning. And during the delivery since baby has passed meconium she even told me about the risk and advised me if I want to go for csec. But since I was almost suffering from pain for few hours and above to deliver in an hour I choose to go for normal delivery only. I finally delivered a healthy baby 3.45kgs with the help of Kalyani mam. Baby was kept under observation in NICU. But it was doing fine. The rooms are really big and very spacious.. well maintained clean and tidy.. environment is also peaceful..it felt like home. The food was provided on time and sisters also were available all the time. during this Covid situation, they are taking a lot of precautions which is really good and you feel really safe to visit there. My heartfelt gratitude to Kalyani mam and all the staff and sisters there for making my journey smooth. I have also recommended my friends and relatives to her. I would highly recommend this doctor. Lastly I would also thank god for giving us a wonderful doctor like Kalyani mam..

review: I know Dr Kalyani Mam from my first pregnancy...i never met doctor who is so calm and composed.she explains everything so nicely and clearly that I came back to Bangalore and contacted mam for my second one too.I wanted her only for my second one also. Both of my pregnancy was happened normally..she always prefers Normal delivery until you have any complications.I had a long labour in my first one...so this time she suggested me to do exercise daily from 36th week onwards.She has appointed one physiotherapist in her hospital. Dr Saloni who is brilliant in her craft...she knows how much exercise and effort needs to give in which week.I attended 12classes which worked like magic in labour room.I was able to do breathing exercises while contractions.Just because of excercise which I had practiced my second went so smooth.In 37th week I came to know in scan that one loop of umbilical chord is there in baby's neck.I thought we have to go for C section but Kalyani mam convinced that she will try for normal one which she did it.In 39th week...I delivered a baby boy.All the staffs are courteous and helpful. Hospital is so neat and well equipped.Rooms are really spacious.Service is really prompt.So overall my experience was superb...I will  say one thing to pregnant ladies out there to do exercise if ur body allows.It really works like magic.I would highly recommend Dr Kalyani and her hospital.And My Gratitude to Dr Kalyani mam,Dr Raja sir(radiologist), Dr Saloni (Physiotherapist) and overall staffs for making my journey really smooth and memorable.

review:
The experience of giving birth is incredible and life changing which is very hard with out help of doctor and I'm really happy with the support I got from Dr Kalyani mam and her staff for my delivery. I always wanted to go with normal delivery which I conveyed same to the Dr and she has suggested all the necessary exercises, diet etc which will help to go through normal delivery and I followed the same. As I'm a foodie i had no control on my food and at 38th week my baby weight was above 3kgs which is very hard to go through normal delivery if baby weight increases as I had nearly 3more weeks left for my due date also my glucose level was 138 which is more and at that time mam has suggested few things on diet also suggested few exercises which helped me in getting my baby get into position also got natural pains before my baby got to overweight. Coming to my labour experience, my labour pains started early morning 2am and I called mam around 4am and she immediately responded to my call and asked to come immediately and by the time I admitted I was diluted by 3-4cms where my baby heartbeat was fluctuating btw 100-120. In this case actually doctors suggest for immediate c section, but Kalyani mam has patiently waited and suggested to take deep breaths which helped me to get my baby heartbeat to the required count and I had very intensive pains where at one point I had no control and asked for c section and at that point I was suggested if I can take Epidural(Pain less anesthesia) and with my acceptance I was given Epidural with which I got relief with my pains. With the help of mam and her staff in labour room I had given birth to a baby boy that too normal delivery. I had to mention the patience level of mam throughout my labour which is hard to see in almost all the hospitals these days and with my experience I can say that she almost tries and give time to her patients try for normal delivery. I should definitely mention the hospital staff and their friendly nature until I got discharged from hospital is highly appreciated.
I suggest kalyani mam for all the women who want a better experience thought out their pregency until their delivery and thanks to Dr Kalyani mam fir making my journey a wonderful one.

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,
review: I am sharing my experience a bit late but it's better late than never. I started consulting Kalyani Mam from 2nd Trimester onwards. We were aspiring for Normal delivery and searching for a doctor who gives priority to Normal delivery. we found her review really good and started consulting her. I was very happy and satisfied from the very first consultation. She is very patient and calm in her approach which will help anyone to deal with any kind of health issues. And most importantly, she never suggests unnecessary tests or check ups, rather advise and encourage to go for home remedies. Like that my 9 months got over and we are blessed with a super cute, and healthy baby boy weigh 3.2kg on 29th April 2019 in Ovum Hospital through normal delivery. One suggestion I would like to give to all the mom-to-be who can go for Normal delivery, please take Epidural during labour pain. Inform Kalyani maam beforehand. Even though I took epidural after 6cm dialation, but it helped me to take rest for sometime, so that I had enough energy to push and baby came out easily. Dr Ravi (her husband) is the ansthesist and did an excellent job when I needed him the most.And special shoutout to Dr Raja, the Radiologist. He is an awesome and very friendly doctor. So my overall experience with Anjani clinic is very good. Clinic Staff is also very good. Even though I have complained so many times about their appointment system, but later I realised there is no way one can manage better than what they are doing now. I would definitely suggest Anjani clinic for a complete maternity service. For delivery, either you can choose Ovum or Motherhood where Dr Kalyani practices.

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,Wait time,
review:
I wish we had our first delivery done through Kalyani Ma'am but I guess we missed a big chunk of good things. She was diligent, throughout and extremely knowledgeable through out our visits. Guided us with practical steps throughout the journey. 

Re the admissions / billing, I'm so glad they are not like the corporate institutions. We came out paying 78K which was exactly what we had prepared for a c-sec and were told that it was not going to exceed that amount. On the day of the delivery, the doc was on time and her husband is another very gentle human being who kept us assured and informed throughout the process. The rooms was just what we needed. Though we didn't have some facilities but who cared? We went for a delivery and came out with out little super start. The nursing staff is super friendly and very helpful. They came every time we needed them and were helpful is assisting with the motor nursing and baby care. The paediatrician Dr. Narendra was also very through with the new born handling procedure guided us through just what was needed and nothing more. Guys, you really define the whole mother and baby care procedures in the day and age of corporates. We know you're set up for success, our request is that you keep this area of healthcare as it is now, no matter how big you grow. 

Thank you Kalyani Ma'am and the entire team of Anjani. We're so lucky to have met you. Thank you for doing what you do. God bless. 

Just a small area of opportunity: If there's anyway you can make the radiologist's room a little more soundproof, I think the Dr there would not have problems with the children outside running around. It is a birthing hospital after all. 

But otherwise, everything else was just awesome! Thank you so much again for a refreshing, different experience all together.
reply_text: Thank you so much for your wonderful  feedback

review:
I would like to share my experiences with you all. 
As soon as I got to know I am pregnant the very first question is which Doctor and Hospital to visit. 

I got to know about Doctor Kalyani and Anjani Hospital via 
BWP Bangalore Women Power Facebook group 
As I hunted the group to know the best doctor in Hennur though I was living in BTM 2nd stage as in near future I had to shift to Hennur area and I didn‚Äôt want to shift the file here n der so for the first 3 months of my pregnancy I travelled all the way from BTM 2nd stage to HBR layout

On BWP group many had recommended Dr. Kalyani from Anjani hospital so I Googled to see the hospital image to understand how the atmosphere will be there as I saw the image my heart was like this place is right and I will definitely will be comfortable here. 
Bcz I was very clear in my mind I don‚Äôt wanna go to any fancy brands of hospitals and was very particular what I was looking for. 

So Finally I visited Doctor Kalyani omg I must say she is such a beauty at heart  n her every smiling face makes you feel fresh. 
So well she guided during the whole pregnancy. 
Even Scan Doctor Raja he explains so well n tells all things in details. Doctor Ravi also guided and explained so well about the anaesthesia as mine was C session he gave confidence.
Doctor Narendra  the Paediatrician also guided so well for the babies do n don‚Äôt 

Even the  Nursing staff, Senior sister Sheena , Chaithra, , Supriya  & all other nurses for extending their support and they are always available for any help
And guide you so well in each and everything needed even for feeding the baby to burping the baby to diaper change n all. 
Even the house keeping staffs are very nice n friendly Nirmala n Bharati 

I can say hospital is very nice and very reasonable in terms of pricing and they have a dedicated person also to help you on insurance so that you don‚Äôt have to run here n there. 

Each room is spacious n well ventilated and is provided with oven, refrigerator, an attached bathroom with water heater.

Over all it was great experience and happy delivery time. 
I keep referring n recommending ppl here so that they don‚Äôt miss the best place for the best experience of life.

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,
review:
This doctor is a very gentle and well-mannered doctor
The doctor speaks so softly that my wife was very happy and satisfied that everything would be fine
Eight months had passed and the ninth month had begun.
One night my wife suddenly stopped feeling moments we went to the doctor first
Doctor checked and said that the heartbeat was not feeling And then an ultrasound showed that the baby had died inside
As soon as it was known, the doctor admit my wife in his hospital
After that my wife started treatment.
Then I asked the doctor why they don't operate when it has happened.
We told the doctor why don't you do the operation when this has happened. The doctor told us that it is not appropriate for the baby to die in the womb, because of which the infection can spread in the body and the mother may have a problem.
So we should try to make the delivery normal
In the evening the doctor said that the delivery should be done by five o'clock in the morning and we will try.
When we were in the hospital, my wife was in a very bad condition and was crying a lot
The style of Dr. Kalyani Reddy and his staff is very good. They supported us a lot.
And because of their excellent treatment and encouragement, the delivery will be at 11:30 pm.
After the delivery, the doctor told us that the baby had died of relapse
The doctor is very gentle and good, very helpful
My wife said that delivery will be very easy with very little pain. Thank you doctor.
These were my wife's words.
We ask Allah to help those who helped us.
May Allah bless you all and keep helping you as you are helping people.

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,
review:
We visited Dr. Kalyani as we were expecting our first child and were looking for an experienced doctor. The good reviews on Practo also helped us in deciding the same. Since the first visit from Jan 2021, the doctor was friendly, communicable, explained all things candidly. We immediately felt at ease and felt confident in receiving expert medical care. The radiologist, nursing staff, and other hospital staff were also helpful and supportive throughout my pregnancy. Doctor asked for our preference for delivery and we wanted it to be a normal delivery. From our first visit itself, the doctor monitored every aspect of my pregnancy. Based on the same doctor judged my and baby's health for normal delivery throughout gestation and carried out safe and normal delivery in spite of delayed dilation. She advised me to have regular walks, squats, Kegels, and using the Indian toilet for aid in normal delivery. The doctor took utmost care of me and my baby at the time of delivery and was available all the time whenever required. She was constantly monitoring me and my baby's vitals throughout the gestation. She also advised us to go for Stem cell banking, the hospital took expert care in collecting and preserving the same during the delivery. We were very impressed with the doctor's expertise, calmness, ease of communication, smiling nature, and candid communication during the tense times. We kept faith in her methods since the first visit and have never regretted it. Radiologist Dr. Munireddy and anesthetist Dr. Kumar were also available and gave expert timely advice. 
We are very happy with the medical treatment and service we received at Anjani Hospital, all of the staff was great they were helpful, patient, and helpful with all our queries. The staff is friendly and always ensures that we got properly informed about my health and post-natal care. We are so glad that we chose Anjani Hospital and would HIGHLY recommend it to anyone. Thank you so much, Dr. Kalyani. We wish you the best.

review: Words would not be enough to describe my experience at Anjani hospital under Dr. Kalyani ma'am's treatment. Actually I started consulting Dr. Kalyani from my 5th month of 2nd pregnancy. I could find her through practo. Thanks to practo for that. The reviews about Anjani hospital and Kalyani maam and her team what we see here are absolutely right. Dr.Kalyani is the passionate doctor I have ever seen in my life. In this covid situation, she gave me full confidence and care like one of my family members.My baby came to head down position from 4 weeks before when it is supposed to happen. Kalyani ma'am immediately noticed it and suggested the precautions to be followed to avoid premature delivery. With her guidance and God's grace, I could deliver my little angel at 38 weeks which is considered to be perfectly full term. The day when I delivered my baby was one of the days where covid cases were at its peak in Bangalore. The entire hospital team put special efforts and care to maintain all hygiene and precautions against covid situation and I got the best care one can expect. And the delivery package and all other fee are very affordable and reasonable. Special mention to the scans done by Dr. Raja. He explains the scanning results in a layman's language so that we could get a comfort after scanning. The team of sisters are highly passionate and they all have well co-ordination. The labour room staff sister chaitra, tamizh and all sisters were very encouraging which helped me to bear even the very intense pains at some stage of my delivery. So totally it was a wonderful experience at Anjani hospital. I would recommend Anjani hospital and Dr.Kalyani maam to those who are in need.

review:
God is great! Thank you almighty!

My family is really thrilled & excited with beautiful moments of life ‚Äì we are blessed with a beautiful little princess on 13 March. 

Would like to thank Dr. Kalyani madam for all the support and guidance throughout the journey.

1)	Dr.Kalyani is very knowledgeable, patient friendly, sincere, humble, soft spoken and caring. No unnecessary tests or scanning prescribed. 
2)	Never asks for weekly consultation or scanning ‚Äì scanning or consultations are advised based on your individual case & complication
3)	Dr. Kalyani is flexible if you prefer c-section on a particular day/time
4)	Clinic is superb neat and clean and the facilities provided are excellent compared other renowned maternity care hospital
5)	Dr, Raja Munireddy (radiologist) is highly skilled and detail oriented person
6)	Clinic is having highly skilled and efficient staff to support both baby and mother ‚Äì Special mention to Sheena, Bincy, Ashwini, Sunanda(Post operative nurse) and Reena(admin) and other supporting staff for all the guidance and support. 
7)	Thank you to Dr. Raju Reddy( Dr. Kalyani madam husband) for all moral support provided during our whole journey

My experience with Anjani clinic is positive and highly recommend anyone who is planning to start a family. On last point, patience is very important to conceive and complete the term of remaining 9 months and also please pay attention to Doctor and understand every bit in detail and use your brain and research to make this whole effort successful.

review: First of all big thanks to each and every member of Anjani Hospital. I shouldn't have called this as hospital because it is just like my second home. Kalyani madam is gifted with amazing patience and knowledge. It seems when it comes to pregnancy it is just a piece of cake for her.She always prefers normal delivery. My journey started with Kalyani madam from 3rd month of my pregnancy and it lasted till my baby's first vaccination üòÄ And trust me, every time when I visited her my confidence was increasing and I always felt like I was in most safe hands üòÄ. I would keep praising her for hours so let me take a break. And thanks for everything Kalyani madam. *** *** *** ***** I should also really grateful to Dr Ravi sir. I knew him as an anesthetic specialist, but he can turn to any good thing when situation demands. I was having tough time with labor, I was with labor for more than 12 hours, and when it was the time to pop out my son I was fainted. But Ravi Sir who stood beside me just like my father and gave me the confidence so that I could push my little one to this beautiful world. hats off to you sir. You are really an amazing and kind person. And there is another amazing person Dr Raja Sir. He is fully packed with his technical knowledge and most generous attitude. He scans every patient to his own satisfaction, which is amazing to see in city like Bangalore. Thanks for all your time and help Sir. Every staff and admin department was on there toes to help. It was just wonderful experience. I would like to conclude saying that Anjani hospital is NOT there to make profit! It is there to give a top quality service. It empowers the true meaning of hospitality.

context: Pregnancy Check Up,Pre and Post Delivery Care,
review:
We are very thankful to Dr. Kalyani C Reddy for providing us an excellent experience through out the pregnancy journey. Dr. listens to all the problems calmly and provides the best advise. She answered our midnight calls and guided us appropriately. This was my second pregnancy after 9 years. I was hoping to have normal delivery this time as my earlier one was a C-section. Dr. encouraged us to go for a normal delivery.  During the initial checkup, she explained us about the possible complications for the normal delivery after a C-section. She advised me with diet and exercises for a normal delivery. During the growth scan at the end of third trimester it was found that the earlier scar was thin than expected to support for a normal delivery. Hence, Dr. advised us to go for a C-section.  We are really happy with the way she explained about each and every thing.
On 6th Feb 2019, I had my regular checkup done with the Dr. Soon after I stepped out of the clinic, my water broke. It became an emergency situation. Dr. immediately guided us to the hospital with instructions. Within next 2 hours, we were blessed with a cute little baby Boy :). We really appreciate her commitment towards her patient and she provides the best care and support always. We heart-fully thank Dr. Kalyani C Reddy, Dr. Ravi Kumar, Dr. Raja and all the nurses at the clinic.  We would not be able to forget the experience we had at Anjani Clinic.  We strongly recommend Dr. Kalyani C Reddy for all pregnancy related counseling and treatment.

Thank you a ton Mam and to the team :)

Regards,
Madhu Bala & Dinesh :)

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,
context: Pregnancy Check Up,Pregnancy care and management,Tubal Ligation,
review:
Pregnancy experience with the Dr. Kalyani C Reddy for my wife was Amazing, few things we would like to mention here:
We are returned from UK, after long gap (first baby is 8-year-old) From the time my wife got conceived till date (7days post-delivery all formalities are completed in awesome fashion) my wife was under Dr. Kalyani hood for her 2nd Pregnancy. 
She always smiles talks very nicely and listens to my wife issues/concerns which are common during pregnancy suggests very easy remedies for respective problem. It was sweet journey for us and my wife enjoyed every moment of it. She shared her mobile number during early days pregnancy visit itself and strictly mentioned to us for emergency calls only otherwise for any queries text messages.
In the entire 39 weeks of pregnancy she was on liberal/normal diet(Non-veg). First she tried for Normal delivery though first one was C-section due to various reasons (Scar thickness, pain at scar, baby weight etc. the risks are explained to us clearly) we opted for C-section (2nd time as well). 
She never prescribed any unnecessary tests, scans or medicines, she also helped in choosing best hospital for delivery without interfering in my final decision. 
After final scan @35 weeks my baby weight was approx. 2.990kg, she suggested 38 weeks +5 days grace period for D-Day. She had given freedom to choose flexible date and time for D-day. 
The D-Day was on November 14th and we are blessed with healthy baby boy(3.64KG). It was Wednesday evening we were admitted few hours before C-section doctor arrived on time and within 20 minutes I saw my dream baby and provided my consent in few seconds for family planning as well (This was well planned but requested Dr. Kalyani to have a word with me post-cesarean). The hospital experience was awesome and postnatal service by Kalyani was great. The Mother and Baby are doing GREAT at the time of review. 

If you have to choose gynecologist in North Bangalore, please go and choose Dr. Kalyani. The rest will be taken care by her.

Thank you Dr. Kalyani!!! we will remember you forever at least once in a day irrespective of country we are staying.

regards, Anjani women s day care

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,
context: Labor and Delivery,Pre and Post Delivery Care,
review:
I am extremely thankful to Dr.Kalyani for everything she has done for me and my child's well being throughout my pregnancy. I have been consulting her since the time we made plans to conceive. From the first time I was very comfortable with her as she always insisted on going the natural ways like weight loss and exercises to be able to conceive spontaneously. And I conceived with just a few lifestyle changes like 40 mins walk a day. 

Despite her busy schedule, she manages to keep us informed and makes us feel reassured that we are taken care of. I am a very restless person by nature, and nobody but Dr. Kalyani could have helped me through my pregnancy with such peace of mind. Though I had low fluid levels and a few other observations in my scans, I don't remember one time when I walked out with a tensed mind after a consultation with her. 

During delivery too, she was very calm which was of immense support for me and my family.  When the labour pain became very intense, I cried for help. Herself and Dr. Ravi tried to calm me down, but I was blinded by the pain and hardly listened to them. As the baby passed motion in the womb subsequently, I had to go for a c section. 
As much as Dr. Kalyani helped me through my pregnancy, Dr. Ravi helped me through the final stage of my delivery. If not him, I would not held to my nerves. I am very much indebted to the both of them! 

The only concern I have is with Ovum hospitals. Facilities are average, I felt very uncomfortable with a few nurses (of course, night duty nurses are angels! they are extremely helpful)  and the labour room environment itself gave me a disturbed mind.  Because it is very close to Dr. Kalyani's clinic we had opted for it. As she was around, I was okay with the hospital, but would have  preferred some other if I had the choice. 

The staff at Anjani clinic are also very friendly, helpful and attentive. 

Overall, I would strongly suggest Dr. Kalyani and Anjani clinic to anybody who wants help with pregnancy.

review: In starting i consulted dr sapna lulla when i found m pregnant, but after seeing long queues and indefinite delay i switced to dr kalyani, she was good in on time appointments, always avaialble on whatsapp for queries and listen the problem carefully, it made me think i chose right dr for my delievery, entire pregnancy period was fine till the last month, in last month doc asked me to check for chord around the neck of baby in last ultrasound, i did that and found out thr was single loop of chord ws thr around baby neck, though it happens around 90% cases, but since it was my first pregnancy i became little scared but wanted to go for normal delievery, dr knew that m scared and she gave me so many negative examples of her existing patients to not to take risk and entire decision left on us to either go for c section or go for normal delievery, we as a patient treat the dr as god and totaly dependent on them that they will do right for us  but on the contrary dr became so professional and left the decision on us, my case was normal and i dn had any other problem other than single loop of chord which is very common in pregnancy, but due to dr i lost my confidence and opted for c section for which still i feel.so bad cause i see so many similar cases as mine which ends with normal delievey, if my dr would hv given  me encouragement and not acted professionaly i could have tried normal delievery at least, i really not recommended her cause she is good only for on time appointments and availability but not for final outcome. I used to travel all the way from marathalli  to kalyan nagar only for the sake of the dr but my decision to trust her was wrong.
reply_text:
It‚Äôs our duty to explain the involved risks in a procedure and to make the patient and the family understand the possible consequences. There have been many cases where we have delivered with cord around the neck. If the patient and the family is unwilling to take the risk of such a delivery, the we are bound to take the other option at that time. If you and your family had stood by the decision for a normal deliver, then we would have conducted the same.

	Now that everything has ended fine, you can sit back and retrospectively comment on what happened. But in case you unfortunately belonged to the other 10% and had a complication during a normal delivery, how would you have justified  the risk-benefit assessment? Would you have then appreciated us for taking the risk knowingly? All said and done it was your family decision to avoid any kind of risk to the baby or the mother which obligates us to take the decision at that time.

tags: None
review:
Dr. Kalyani Reddy was my maternity gynaecologist and obstetrician.  We were referred to her by a friend and did our first pregnancy check up with her. We consulted her for the full term of pregnancy culminating with a normal delivery. We now continue to consult with her for post-delivery.

She has immense patience during every visit.  She listens carefully, consults on any issues urgently, educates on best practices and always motivates for a normal delivery.  She consistently targets normal delivery with regular reminders (during consultation) of how to prepare for it. 

I should make mention here of Dr‚Äôs husband, Dr Ravi, who arrived urgently in the morning to give me the epidural after I was no longer able to bear the pain and was dilated to almost 5 cms. An epidural, when done by an experienced and intuitive doctor like him, is a safe procedure and way better than getting a C-section.  He is also quite patient and together they make a great team. In the OT, he assisted me by pushing against my abdomen to guide the baby out.

We had a situation during normal delivery where the baby‚Äôs heart rate suddenly dropped to 60-70 and there was also a loop of cord around the baby. The doctor urgently arrived at the hospital early   morning, stirred up the hospital team and prepared for C-section (after she informed my husband of the situation, that she would continue to target normal delivery inside the Operation Theater and that C-section would be performed in emergency only). Along the way to the OT, my mother-in-law requested her again to try for normal delivery and even in that tense pressure situation, Dr Kalyani returned twice to reassure my mother-in-law that C-section would be done only in case normal was too risky.

In the OT, Dr Kalyani motivated me and though I was exhausted, I got the strength to do a normal delivery within just 20 min. My mom and mom-in-law, who were praying different religions outside, were overjoyed (not to mention my relieved husband).

I would certainly recommend Dr Kalyani.

tags: None
review: Dr Kalyani is such a wonderful doctor who puts patients wellness as first priority. I visited her for my first pregnancy and right from the first consultation me and my husband felt we are in the best  hands. She always spends good enough time during every consultation and answers all our queries and explains our situation well. Never suggested us things which are unwanted be it any tests or scans and always suggested what is important and needed. On the day when my labour started Dr Kalyani visited me 4 times in the hospital and was constantly checking my status when she was not there, I had a 14.5 hrs of labour which started at 3 am in the morning. My water broke and I phoned Dr Kalyani and she picked my call in the first ring which made me feel assured and confident once again that me and my baby are in safe hands. During the last 3 hours I entered critical condition as I had started bleeding fresh blood which is risky for both me and baby. Dr Kalyani didn‚Äôt leave me a moment since then and whole 3 hours after that she was with me,constantly monitoring both me and baby. She gave me assurance and confidence to push and reconfirmed often that both me and baby are doing good as our heart rates were normal irrespective of blood loss and finally I delivered my baby normally and now me and baby are doing good and we are healthy. Even when I was in the hospital post delivery for the next 2 days Dr Kalyani visited me often and checked my health status. I would strongly recommend Dr Kalyani for anyone who wants to have a safe and healthy pregnancy. She would do all that in her hands and also go to any level and assure a healthy pregnancy and delivery. It‚Äôs not easy to find such a doctor these days. My baby, my husband, my family and I are always grateful and thankful to Dr Kalyani

tags: Explanation of the health issue,
review:
We visited Dr. Kalyani for first pregnancy and I had normal delivery.Every visit for regular checkups was so much of positivity. Most importantly there were no unnecessary tests. 
In the eighth month scan we found baby's weight was more  than the average, I had gastetational diabetes and the amniotic fluid index was also on the higher side.                Dr. Kalyani advised me not to gain to much weight or else I may end up having c-section, and she told me to follow strict low carb diet, no processed food and oily food to avoid weight gain.In the 9th month of pregnancy I completely stoped having white rice( included brown rice twice a week) and had only millets, veggies which helped me to balance my weight and baby's weight. 
Exercise plays a major role,especially in the 9th month of pregnancy if you want to have normal delivery. Exercising regularly will surely help to combat stress and pain of labour. Exercise(which were taught in Physiotherapy session) and walking for about 90min(7000-8000 steps) a day helped me to encourage my baby to drop into my pelvis.

I want to thank kalyani doctor for doing normal delivery for both of my kids during my pregnancies. .Doctor always suggests for normal delivery when there is no health complications. Doctor is very caring and attentive during labour contractions and her firm ,bold decision at the right time during labour is appreciable 
The doctor is very friendly and she explains the medical terms in such a way where the common man can understand and her extreme patience for all queries we ask is commendable . I wanted the same doctor without a second thought even during my second pregnancy as well hence visited her and during regular check up it was observed that I was putting on weight more than 3 kg every month and doctor was suggesting me not to increase more than 1.5kg in last few months but I did not control my food habits, regular walking was not done , as a result baby weighted more than 3.1 kg at 37 weeks and I struggled a lot with pain in labor room for 2hrs with high contractions to go for normal delivery, finally I was drained out with no energy and then doctor immediately decided to do normal vaginal vacuum delivery and it was done Smoothly with no harm to baby, 
so suggest every one in last few months not to gain too much  weight , eat food while hungry but do walking and regular exercise as suggested by doctor,if baby weight is less than 3 kg and your health is normal without any issues then it would be easy for normal delivery .
